title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.3: JUSTICE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: By the end of 2020, services with a child justice mandate increased their capacity to prevent juvenile delinquency and provide services to children in conflict with the law, including a broader range of options diversion, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents, especially girls, have access to appropriate and sustainable child protection services in a favourable social environment

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2020, services with a child justice mandate increased their capacity to prevent juvenile delinquency and provideservices to children in conflict with the law, including a broader range of options diversion

description.narrative: In 2020, the Country Office strengthened the capacities of justice actors relative to: 1) the separation of children from adults in places of detention, 2) the improvement of the functioning of the courts, and 3) the strengthening of minors and their families’ access to justice services. The Country Office contributed to the improvement of minor’s detention conditions in prisons, to the improvement of the treatment of children in conflict with the law and to the prioritization of alternative measures over the deprivation of liberty. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/01/2021
